thread.title: Mets' Terry Collins on NLDS Game 3: 'We're not throwing at anybody'
thread.title_full: Mets' Terry Collins on NLDS Game 3: 'We're not throwing at anybody' - CBSSports.com

author: Dayn Perry
title: Mets' Terry Collins on NLDS Game 3: 'We're not throwing at anybody'
text:
You know the source of the intrigue by now ... In Game 2 of the NLDS between the Mets and Dodgers , L.A. infielder Chase Utley keyed a seventh-inning rally by executing a hard takeout slide on Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada -- a slide that broke Tejada's league and ended his postseason . (Utley was suspended for Games 3 and 4 by MLB , but because Utley's appeal of the suspension is pending he's still eligible to play.)
As for Game 3 of this particular NLDS, it will take place at Citi Field on Monday, with first pitch scheduled for 8:37 pm ET ( LAD-NYM preview/GameTracker ). Brett Anderson will oppose Matt Harvey .
Speaking of Harvey, if the New York Daily News is any guide -- and in this instance, it probably is -- then retribution in the form of a pitched baseball is the expectation ... 

As it turns out, though, Mets manager Terry Collins isn't on board with any purpose pitches, at least not in this particular high-stakes playoff game ... 
Terry Collins says he instructed Matt Harve not to throw at anyone. #Mets 
— Anthony DiComo (@AnthonyDiComo) October 12, 2015 A little more from Collins, this time with an eye toward another day ...
Terry Collins says no retribution tonight. "We're not throwing at anybody," he said. "We'll figure this out at a later date."
— Adam Rubin (@AdamRubinESPN) October 12, 2015 Utley's not in the starting lineup for the Dodgers , even though he's eligible to play for the time being. That means Harvey and the Mets may not get a shot at the main offender. Even so, Collins surely knows that in a postseason series such as this, you'd best not willingly put a runner on the bases. 
It is a fact of true lore than every baseball team keeps in the manager's office a tattered manila folder that reads on the tab, "Revenge List." All of this, possibly, will go in there. 
Developing.
Topics: Brett Anderson , Chase Utley , Matt Harvey , Ruben Tejada , Los Angeles Dodgers , New York Mets , MLB
